cab.content:
SECRET
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 19th SEPTEMBER 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
There is nothing of interest to report from either the British or the French Front, and no change in the situation.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
There is no change.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
Serbian operations continue satisfactorily. This morning Serbian cavalry reached Polosko without opposition. Other cavalry units are marching on PRILEP. ALCHAR, ROZDEN, TUSIN and NONTE have been captured, also RASIN BEY on the CERNA River.
On the British front, British and Greek troops attacked both east and west of LAKE DOIRAN. The fighting has been severe and progress has been made. The operations are continuing. Prisoners counted up to the present exceed 700.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
19th September 1918.
Issued at 6.50 p.m.
